items.title: Live: Nationals split Coalition, Littleproud blames Ley for 'untenable' position
items.description: After quitting the shadow ministry en masse in solidarity with three colleagues dumped for crossing the floor on hate laws, Nationals leader David Littleproud says the Coalition has been forced into an "untenable position that can no longer continue". Follow live.

items.title: Trump drops Greenland tariffs threat as he heralds 'future deal' with NATO
items.description: Donald Trump says he has agreed to a "framework of a future deal" on Greenland after talks with NATO's secretary-general, and he will no longer impose tariffs on European nations that had opposed a US takeover.

items.title: Debt is America's Achilles heel in a fracturing world order
items.description: For decades, global investors have bought US government debt as a safe haven when things turn pear-shaped. But investor attitudes are changing, and America's financial domination is at stake.

items.title: City real estate prices on record rebound as million-dollar club grows
items.description: The Melbourne real estate market is leading a "decisive recovery", according to property portal Domain, as the city hits a four-year high for its median house price after strong growth across the country last year.

items.title: Australia earns global praise for 'soft landing' but still dependent on China
items.description: A new report from the OECD says Australia's economy is returning to normal but remains vulnerable and lacks dynamism.

items.title: Bondi lifeguard who ran towards terror attack remembers 'fear in victims' eyes'
items.description: Much of Jackson "Jacko" Doolan's memory from December 14 is a blur, but there is one moment that remains crystal clear.

items.title: 'Ten-pound Pom' vows to boycott UK over 'money grab' passport changes
items.description: People who came to Australia as children from the UK as part of an organised migration scheme say they the UK's new regulations for dual citizens unfairly targets them.

items.title: Fetal heart monitors still available online despite being banned
items.description: Home fetal doppler devices were banned from sale in Australia last year but they are still readily available for purchase online, prompting experts to issue warnings.

items.title: Five quick hits: Sinner weighs up Kyrgios vs Kim and an Aussie exodus
items.description: Jannik Sinner was stuck in an awkward moment discussing Nick Kyrgios and Kim Jong-Un while Coco Gauff shared her top artists. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

items.title: Republicans push to hold Clintons in contempt over Epstein probe
items.description: The Clintons are refusing to testify before a committee in the US House of Representatives, accusing Republicans of leading a weaponised process against them.

items.title: Children and journalists among 11 people killed by Israel in Gaza
items.description: According to Palestinian medics, two boys aged 10 and 13 were among those killed on Wednesday in the latest violence which threatens to undermine a fragile ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas.

items.title: 'Constant worry': Ukraine endures bitterest winter as Russia targets energy sites
items.description: The war-ravaged country has been plunged into an energy crisis as temperatures plummet below freezing, leaving millions unable to heat their homes.

items.title: Prince Harry testifies tabloids made wife Meghan's life 'absolute misery'
items.description: An emotional Prince Harry held back tears as he described the impact of media coverage on his wife Meghan Markle.

items.title: Victoria's coal country set to become home of $10 billion data centre
items.description: Victoria's east is set to become home to a $10 billion data centre that will support the technology necessary for artificial intelligence systems.

items.title: 'I've been so stressed': Adelaide Uni merger causing stress for some students
items.description: The Adelaide University merger has been labelled a "shambles" by some students who say they have been unable to enrol in courses or receive timely communication from the new university.

items.title: Shark safety strategies at your favourite beach depend where it is
items.description: Shark mitigation measures have come a long way since the first nets were rolled out in Sydney almost 90 years ago.

items.title: Live: ASX to open higher as Trump walks back tariff threats
items.description: The ASX is set to open higher as Donald Trump withdraws his threat to impose new tariffs. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: Hand stencils discovered in Indonesia are world's oldest-known rock art
items.description: Faint ochre outlines of hands thought to be at least 67,800 years old are the oldest rock art yet discovered. Archaeologists say the discovery of the Indonesian cave art backs up estimates of when humans first reached Australia.

items.title: Mass power outages from dust pollution see SA Power deploy taskforce
items.description: Ongoing dry conditions across South Australia since 2024 are causing dust and salt to build up across inland and coastal power networks, polluting insulators and leading to mass blackouts.

items.title: With blackouts expected to intensify as storms do, could a smart grid be the answer?
items.description: Tens of thousands of homes across Queensland have lost power during storms this season – an uncomfortable, expensive experience, which could become more common.

items.title: You may want to think twice about submitting that ancestry DNA test
items.description: If you're thinking of taking an ancestry DNA test as "a bit of fun", experts warn there is the risk of uncovering more than you bargained for.

items.title: Man City players reimburse fans after shock Champions League loss
items.description: Manchester City players combine to pay back the cost of match tickets to fans who travelled to freezing Norway for a shock Champions League defeat to Bodø/Glimt.

items.title: Hurricanes win in the rain to keep BBL title defence alive
items.description: The Hobart Hurricanes hold their nerve to beat the Melbourne Stars in a rain-shortened Big Bash elimination final.

items.title: Tobacco companies targeting gen Z through social media
items.description: Experts say Australia risks becoming complacent in the war against tobacco, with big companies pivoting to social media to "greenwash" their products to generation Z.

items.title: 'I want them to stop': Sawfish and sharks found mutilated
items.description: Residents and experts say they are shocked and concerned after social media images showed a number of endangered and protected marine animals impaled and severed on a stretch of WA coastline in just a few weeks.
